definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: I got a splinter in my finger while I was moving the boxes.
sentences.chinese: 我在搬箱子的時候手指頭上紮了一根刺。

sentences.english: No one could account for the fact that one of the boxes was extremely heavy.
sentences.chinese: 此中有隻箱子特別重，可誰也弄不清是怎麼回事。

sentences.english: The box was full of sand.
Let me help you carry this suitcase.
sentences.chinese: 讓我來幫您提這個箱子。

sentences.english: John couldn't even pick up the box, much less carry it upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 約翰連這箱子提都提不起來，更別說把它搬上樓了。

sentences.english: This box is very light, and I move.
They prised the box open with a lever.
sentences.chinese: 他們用槓桿把箱子撬開。

sentences.english: Sammy: Look like you just make some wood squares from these boxes here.
sentences.chinese: 看上去你只是用了這些箱子上的木框。

sentences.english: We rode on a huge horse. Grumdalclitch carried me in my box.
sentences.chinese: 我們騎在大馬上，葛蘭朵克麗琪則抱着裝我的箱子。
請打出上部箱子中的信件。

sentences.english: He went in carrying his suitcase.
The black stitching around the toe box gives the shoe a good punch.
sentences.chinese: 黑縫在腳趾箱子附近給鞋子好拳打。

sentences.english: Last Saturday, Kevin put things in boxes all day. He went to bed very late that night.
sentences.chinese: 上星期日，克文整天放東西到箱子裏，他那晚很晚睡。

sentences.english: Mother went into the attic where she poked about among old boxes and trunks.
sentences.chinese: 母親走上頂樓，在舊箱子裏東翻西找。

sentences.english: These huge boxes should be, and can only be moved by rollers.
sentences.chinese: 這些大箱子必須用滾槓，否則根本挪不動。
